title: Crop Rotation Benefits
content: Rotate your crops each season to reduce soil depletion and minimize pests and diseases. For example, follow legumes with cereals to naturally enrich nitrogen levels in the soil.

title: Water Conservation Techniques
content: Use drip irrigation or early morning watering to reduce water loss through evaporation. Mulching also helps retain soil moisture.

title: Organic Pest Control
content: Consider using neem oil, garlic spray, or companion planting to control pests without chemicals. Marigolds, for instance, deter nematodes and aphids.

title: Community Equipment Sharing
content: Form a local co-op to share expensive farming equipment like tractors and harvesters. It lowers individual costs and builds community bonds.

title: Weather Watch Groups
content: Create a local WhatsApp or Telegram group to share weather alerts and crop updates. Quick communication can prevent crop losses during unexpected weather events.

title: Use of Compost and Natural Fertilizers
content: Make compost from farm waste and animal manure. It improves soil health, boosts productivity, and reduces reliance on chemical fertilizers.

title: Market Linkage Tips
content: Collaborate with other farmers to negotiate better rates and transport for your produce. Selling in bulk through a farmers' group can attract larger buyers.
